intro: Lithospermum leymebambense, commonly known as the African burnet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant produces distinctive, elongated, reddish-brown seeds enclosed in a capsule. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open grasslands or along riverbanks. Lithospermum leymebambense is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional African medicine.
